alert.note: Alert for Newton; Rockdale (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 7:57PM EST until January 11 at 11:24AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Georgia... Yellow River at Gees Mill Road affecting Rockdale and Newton Counties. For the Yellow River Basin...including Gees Mill Road...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO LATE THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Yellow River at Gees Mill Road. * WHEN...From this evening to late Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding continues in the woodlands...fields and pasture along the river upstream and downstream from the gage on Gees Mill Road in Rockdale County. Large portions of Sockwell Road by the river in Newton County will be up to 3 feet under water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 11.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:30 PM EST Tuesday was 11.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 16.2 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.3 feet on 05/07/2003. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 800 AM EST.
